title: Bug 32286: ControlExample Button Tab: changing styles resets button orientation
description:
Bug 32286 ControlExample Button Tab: changing styles resets button orientation. Ensure that Eclipse is not running. Accept new configuration defaults.
4. The buttons will change to arrow buttons, pointing up.
7.
OB: Problem Description: When using the Button controls from the SWT Controls example, if SWT.ARROW buttons are used and the SWT.BORDER property is selected or deselected, the arrow alignment property of all the arrow buttons is reset to UP.
EB: Expected Behavior: The arrow alignment property of the arrow buttons should not be reset when changing the SWT.BORDER property.
SR:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the SWT Controls view.
2. Go to the Button tab.
3. Select SWT.ARROW buttons.
4. Select or deselect the SWT.BORDER property.
5. Observe that the arrow buttons change their orientation.
6. Verify that the arrow buttons' orientation returns to normal when the SWT.BORDER property is changed.
